component.text:
Type Definition
Normal range VLANs
  • Used in small- and medium-sized business and enterprise networks.
  • Identified by VLAN IDs between 1 and 1005.
  • IDs 1 and 1002 to 1005 are automatically created and cannot be removed. (IDs 1002 through 1005 are reserved for Token Ring and Fiber Distributed Data Interface [FDDI] VLANs.)
  • Configurations are stored within a VLAN database file called vlan.dat, which is stored in flash memory.
Extended range VLANs
  • Used by service providers and large organizations to extend their infrastructure to a greater number of customers.
  • Identified by a VLAN ID between 1006 and 4094.
  • Support fewer VLAN features than normal range VLANs.
  • Configurations are saved in the running configuration file.
